meanings.definition: The end of a railroad track where trains load and unload passengers or cargo.
meanings.sent1: The passengers waited at the railheads for the train to arrive.
meanings.sent2: The cargo was carefully unloaded at the railheads.
meanings.sent3: The railheads were like busy gateways for the trains.
meanings.sent4: The railheads stood as the bustling heart of the railway station.
meanings.sent5: The sound of trains echoed loudly at the railheads.

meanings.definition: A point where a railway line ends or begins.
meanings.sent1: The workers repaired the tracks near the railheads.
meanings.sent2: The railheads marked the start of the long railway journey.
meanings.sent3: The railheads seemed to be the magical boundary of the railway world.
meanings.sent4: The railheads were the gatekeepers of the railway network.
meanings.sent5: The sun set beautifully near the railheads.
